}}  'Posttraumatic stress disorder' Acceptable variants of this term exist; see
[[#Terminology|Terminology]] section in this article. ('PTSD') is a severe
condition that may develop after a person is exposed to one or more traumatic
events, such as sexual assault, serious injury or the threat of death. The diagnosis may be given when a group of symptoms such as
disturbing recurring flashbacks, avoidance or numbing of memories of the event,
and hyperarousal (high levels of anxiety) continue for more than a month after
the traumatic event.

Most people who experience a traumatizing event will not develop PTSD. However,
because women are more likely to experience more high impact trauma, they are
more likely to develop PTSD than men. Children are less likely to experience PTSD after
trauma than adults, especially if they are under 10 years of age.
